questions.question: What does Miss Bingley invite Elizabeth to do with her?

choices.answer: Go to the Inner Station and meet Mr. Kurtz.
Walk around the room with her.
Go sailing on her yacht.
Play a game of checkers.

questions.question: What does Elizabeth think is Mr. Darcy's primary fault?

choices.answer: She thinks he hates everyone.
She thinks he has low self-esteem.
She thinks he has poor grooming habits.
She thinks he doesn't dance well.

questions.question: What does Mr. Darcy think is Elizabeth's main fault?

choices.answer: That she is too pretty.
That she has poor grooming habits.
That she talks too much and listens too little.
That she misunderstands people, maybe on purpose.

questions.question: Why is Elizabeth anxious to get back home?

choices.answer: She's worried Mr. Bingley is beginning to fall for her.
She is tired of Mr. Darcy constantly hitting on her.
She's got some business at home to take care of.
She feels they are overstaying their welcome at Netherfield.

questions.question: Who is Mr. Collins? Why has he come?

choices.answer: A roving preacher. To spread the gospel.
Mr. Bennet's cousin. To marry one of the Bennet sisters.
A tax collector. To get money from Mr. Bennet.
Darcy's cousin. To pay Darcy a loan back.

questions.question: Why does Collins want to marry one of the girls?

choices.answer: He wants to get their house and farm.
He doesn't really, he's just messing with Mr. Bennet.
The property is entailed to him so he hopes it will help.
He heard they are some of the best cooks around.

questions.question: Who is Mr. Collins' patroness?

choices.answer: Lady Jane Smith, princess of Wales.
Lady Catherine de Bourgh, a super rich aristocrat.
Countess Grantham of Downton.
Princess Leia of Alderaan

questions.question: How does Mr. Collins feel about having his particular patroness?

choices.answer: He's embarrassed by her.
He's actually in love with her and wants to marry her.
He low key hates her because she's so rich.
He feels so lucky he can't stop saying how awesome she is.

questions.question: What does Mr. Collins read to the Bennet girls after dinner?

choices.answer: The bible, the gospel of Luke
A book of sermons
Sense and Sensibility
Heart of Darkness

questions.question: What is the name of the handsome young man the girls meet?

choices.answer: Mr. Grantham
Mr. Wickham
Mr. Bieber
Mr. Gollywoggles

questions.question: What's the problem between him and Darcy?

choices.answer: He says Darcy kept him from inheriting his father's money.
He says Darcy borrowed money and won't repay it.
He says Darcy should have married his sister but won't.
He says Darcy lied to him about a job.

questions.question: How long has Mr. Wickham known Darcy?

choices.answer: Since they were teens
Since he joined the army
Since grade school
Since infancy

questions.question: What is Mr. Darcy's relationship to Lady Catherine?

choices.answer: He is her nephew and he is supposed to marry her daughter.
He is her godson and heir to her great fortune.
He is her 2nd cousin on his mother's side.
He is her ex-boyfriend and sometime lover.

questions.question: What does Elizabeth think about Mr. Wickham's story?

choices.answer: She is skeptical because he is a stranger to her.
She thinks he's lying; Darcy is not that mean.
She thinks it is half-true, but not totally.
She believes him; she doesn't think he would lie.

questions.question: Why doesn't Wickham attend the ball?

choices.answer: He wasn't invited and it would be rude to just show up.
He's avoiding Darcy but says he has business in town.
He is avoiding Elizabeth because he's afraid she's in love.
He is afraid Bingley will challenge him to a fight.

questions.question: What does Mr. Darcy say about Mr. Wickham?

choices.answer: That Wickham is a remarkable man with a voice, a voice!
That Wickham is a horrible liar and should be shot.
That Wickham is able to make friends, but not keep them.
That Wickham has good manners for a soldier.

questions.question: Why does Mr. Collins think he is being generous by asking Elizabeth to marry him?

choices.answer: Because she is poor and he will inherit her family's estate.
Because Lady Catherine will give her some beautiful clothes.
Because he is so handsome and many girls want to marry him.
Because he can give her a shipment of ivory.

questions.question: What does Mr. Collins think of Elizabeth's response?

choices.answer: He is overjoyed that she said yes.
He doesn't think she means no, and will propose again.
He doesn't believe her and tells everyone she said yes.
He is flattered that she gave him so much consideration.

questions.question: What does Mrs. Bennet threaten to do to Elizabeth?

choices.answer: She will beat her with a wooden spoon until she accepts.
She will never see her again if she doesn't accept.
She will lock her in her room until she accepts.
She will marry Collins herself if she doesn't accept.

questions.question: What does Mr. Bennet threaten to do to Elizabeth?

choices.answer: He will marry her to an older man if she doesn't accept.
He will not speak to her until she accepts.
He will never see her again if she does accept the proposal.
He will make Lydia marry Collins if she doesn't accept.
